answers.answer: Hi,How are you? This can also be caused by other conditions such as Bell's palsy  which is a form of temporary facial paralysis resulting from damage or trauma to one of the facial nerves. With a problem with your optic nerve, this may also be possible. The symptoms of Bell's palsy usually begin suddenly and range in severity from mild weakness to total paralysis.It may also present with twitching, weakness, or paralysis, drooping eyelid or corner of the mouth, drooling, dry eye or mouth, impairment of taste, and excessive tearing in the eye. Have this evaluated by your doctor for proper diagnosis. Take care and regards.

question: About a week ago, I noticed that my left top lip had gone a little numb, it also felt like it was creeping into my upper left cheek (kind of a cold feeling).  It went away, but it came back today, same feeling (while I was walking my dog).  I have a history of ovarian cancer (diagnosed 5 years ago) and have had one recurrence.  I still have neuropathy in my toes.  Currently, I am undergoing testing for possible optic nerve problems in my left eye - About three months ago I started losing vision in my left eye.  I am 59 years old and in good health otherwise, low blood pressure, no diabetes, although I am a light smoker.  Could the numb lip have anything to do with the optic nerve??  What could be going on?
title: numbness in lip
